legacy.blocked: Nevela's Automation Suite is incompatible with the legacy module(s) {legacyList}. These modules are no longer supported. Disable them to use Nevela's Automation Suite. (The legacy migration tool remains available.)

damageTypePriority.name: Custom Damage Type Priority
damageTypePriority.hint: Add custom damage types to be counted as damage reduction types. Magic is at least 1, Cold Iron and Silver types are 3, Adamantine is 4 and Alignments are 5 by default.

damageTypePriorityMenu.name: Configure Damage Type Priority
damageTypePriorityMenu.label: Configure
damageTypePriorityMenu.hint: Open the configuration form to set damage type priority.

customSetting.name: Custom Damage Types
customSetting.label: Configure Custom Damage Types
customSetting.hint: Add or edit custom damage types for the module.

massiveDamage.name: Massive Damage Rule
massiveDamage.hint: Enable the optional Massive Damage rule (Pathfinder Core Rulebook p.189). When a creature takes damage from a single attack equal to or greater than its massive damage threshold, it must make a Fortitude save or die.

metamagicCastTimeRule.name: Metamagic Cast Time
metamagicCastTimeRule.hint: Choose how metamagic affects spontaneous casting time.

persistentSpellTargetMode.name: Persistent Spell Targets
persistentSpellTargetMode.hint: Choose how targets are determined when using the chat save button for Persistent Spell.

choices.message: Use targets stored on the chat card

saveRollTokenInteraction.name: Save Roll Token Interaction
saveRollTokenInteraction.hint: Add a clickable token image to saving throw roll messages.

placeholders.name: Enter the new damage type name here...

tooltips.name: Enter the name of the new damage type
tooltips.img: Select an image for the new damage type
tooltips.category:
Select a category or enter a new category name.

The system has the 'Physical', 'Energy', and 'Miscellaneous' categories by default.
tooltips.abbr: Enter the abbreviation of the damage type
tooltips.icon: Enter the icon class and select a color for the new damage type
tooltips.isModifier: Check if this is a modifier
tooltips.flag: Select the type of ability score damage and the ability score

confirmations.clearAll: Are you sure you want to clear all saved values?
confirmations.deleteValue: Are you sure you want to delete "{value}"?

errors.selectAbility: You must select an ability score when specifying a damage type.
errors.flagTypeRequired: Ability damage type must be selected when assigning an ability score.

translationForm.title: Translation Config
translationForm.description: Change the words for 'Hardness', 'Construct Traits', and 'Undead Traits' to their translations in your desired language.

confirmations.clearAll: Are you sure you want to clear all damage types?
confirmations.deleteRow: Are you sure you want to delete this row?
confirmations.deleteValue: Are you sure you want to delete "{value}"?
confirmations.reload: Some of the changed settings will only take effect after the application is reloaded. Do you want to reload now?
confirmations.resetDefaults: Are you sure you want to reset to default values?

errors.imgOrIconRequired: Either an image or an icon class is required.

itemSettings.Title: Item Damage Settings
itemSettings.Description: Configure global damage automation settings for this item.

actionSettings.Description: Configure damage automation settings for this specific action.

settings.BypassHardnessHint: Ignores hardness entirely when dealing damage.
settings.IgnoreHardnessHint: Ignores a specific amount of hardness when dealing damage.
settings.BypassImmunityHint: Bypasses immunity to selected damage types.
settings.BypassResistanceHint: Bypasses resistance to selected damage types.
settings.BypassDRHint: Bypasses DR for selected damage types.

anchored.label: Anchored
anchored.description:
Fixed to a particular location.

Cannot be moved by any external force, including spells like telekinesis.

Cannot perform actions requiring movement.

Can still attack or cast spells if they do not involve changing position.

burning.label: Burning
burning.description: A creature that is burning takes 1d6 fire damage immediately and at the start of each subsequent round until the flames are extinguished. Each round, the creature may attempt a DC 15 Reflex save to put out the fire (success ends the condition). Jumping into water or smothering the flames grants a +4 bonus on this save. Flammable items may also catch fire and require their own saves.

concealment.label: Concealment
concealment.description: Miss chance applies to attacks because the target is concealed. Normal concealment has a lower success threshold than total concealment.

disabled.label: Disabled
disabled.description:
Character with 0 or stable negative hit points.

Can take a single move or standard action each round (but not both).

Moves at half speed.

Standard actions deal 1 damage after completion, risking negative hit points and dying.

Can take swift, immediate, and free actions.

Recovers hit points naturally if helped.

Otherwise, DC 10 Constitution check after 8 hours rest to start natural recovery.

Penalty on check equals negative hit point total.

Failure causes 1 hit point loss but does not cause unconsciousness.

dying.label: Dying
dying.description:
Unconscious and near death.

Negative hit points and not stabilized.

Can take no actions.

On next turn after being reduced to negative hit points, and all subsequent turns:

- DC 10 Constitution check to become stable.

- Penalty on roll equals negative hit point total.

- Natural 20 is an automatic success.

- Failure results in losing 1 hit point.

Stable characters do not need to make this check.

If negative hit points equal Constitution score, the character dies.

energyDrained.label: Energy Drained
energyDrained.description:
Gains one or more negative levels.

Each negative level:

- Cumulative -1 penalty on ability checks, attack rolls, CMB, CMD, saves, and skill checks.

- Reduces current and total HP by 5.

- Treated as one level lower for level-dependent variables (e.g., spellcasting).

If negative levels equal Hit Dice, the character dies.

Temporary energy drains:

- New save each day to remove (DC same as original effect).

Permanent energy drains:

- No daily save to remove.

- Can be removed by spells like restoration.

- Remain after revival.

- Must be removed for effective revival if they equal Hit Dice.

Energy drain is not a death effect.

Death ward grants immunity to energy drain and suspends penalties while active.

fascinated.label: Fascinated
fascinated.description:
Entranced by a supernatural or spell effect.

Stands or sits quietly, taking no actions other than paying attention to the effect.

-4 penalty on skill checks made as reactions (e.g., Perception checks).

Any potential threat (e.g., hostile creature approaching) allows a new saving throw.

Any obvious threat (e.g., drawing a weapon, casting a spell, aiming a ranged weapon) automatically breaks the effect.

An ally can shake the fascinated creature free as a standard action.

grappled.label: Grappled
grappled.description:
Cannot move and is treated as immobilized.

Casting or using spell-like abilities requires a concentration check (DC 10 + spell level + grappler's latest grapple check result).

grappling.label: Grappling
grappling.description:
You are controlling a grapple and are slowed.

Targets you successfully grapple gain the grappled condition.

flatFooted.label: Flat-Footed
flatFooted.description:
Has not yet acted during combat.

Loses Dexterity bonus to AC and CMD.

Cannot make attacks of opportunity, unless having Combat Reflexes feat or Uncanny Dodge class ability.

Characters with Uncanny Dodge retain Dexterity bonus to AC and can make attacks of opportunity before acting in the first round.

Cannot take immediate actions while flat-footed.

immobilized.label: Immobilized
immobilized.description:
Unable to move from current location.

Cannot take any move actions.

Cannot reposition itself.

Can still perform actions that do not require movement (e.g., attacking, casting spells).

petrified.label: Petrified
petrified.description:
Turned to stone and considered unconscious.

If cracked or broken, but pieces are joined with the body upon returning to flesh, the character is unharmed.

If the petrified body is incomplete when returning to flesh, the body remains incomplete, resulting in permanent hit point loss and/or debilitation.

slowed.label: Slowed
slowed.description:
Movement is significantly hindered.

Movement speed is typically reduced by half.

May take fewer actions per turn, often limited to one standard action or move action.

stable.label: Stable
stable.description:
No longer dying but still unconscious.

Stopped losing hit points each round while still having negative hit points.

If stabilized by aid (e.g., Heal check or magical healing), no longer loses hit points.

Can make a DC 10 Constitution check each hour to become conscious and disabled (penalty equals negative hit point total).

If stabilized without aid, still at risk of losing hit points.

Can make a Constitution check each hour to become stable (as if received aid), but each failed check causes 1 hit point loss.

unconscious.label: Unconscious
unconscious.description:
Knocked out and helpless.

Can result from having negative hit points (but not more than the creature's Constitution score) or from nonlethal damage exceeding current hit points.

effects.3a: draws their {itemName} and inflicts {damage} points of damage to themselves with it.
effects.3b: strikes themselves in the face with their fists, causing {damage} points of bludgeoning damage.

main.GrappledTwoHands: {name} cannot perform this action due to being grappled and it requires two hands.
main.GrappledLenient: {name} is grappled but can perform the action under lenient handling.
main.NauseatedStrict: {name} cannot perform this action due to being nauseated; only move actions are allowed.
main.NauseatedLenient: {name} is nauseated but can perform other actions under lenient handling.
main.SqueezingStrict: {name} cannot perform attack actions due to being squeezed.
main.SqueezingLenient: {name} is squeezing but can perform attacks under lenient handling.
main.GrappleNoTargets: Grapple requires at least one target.
main.GrappleFootnote: +[[5]] circumstance bonus on grapple checks made against the same grappled target in subsequent rounds.
main.GrappleConcentrationDC: Concentration DC vs grapple: {dc} (10 + spell level {spellLevel} + grapple check {grappleTotal}).

sockets.MaxMoveWarning: This token cannot move more than {limitFeet} feet.
sockets.BlindMovementSpeedPrompt: Choose which speed type this movement uses.
sockets.BlindMovementSpeedInfo: You can move up to {halfSpeed} feet without an Acrobatics check.
sockets.HardToKillPrompt: {name} has a hard to kill ability. Would you like to continue fighting or fall unconscious?
sockets.BlindMovementCheckPrompt: {name} is blind and needs to make a DC 10 Acrobatics check to move without falling prone.

buffs.UnableToApplyAutomaticBuffs: Unable to apply automatic buffs for {name} - no targets selected.
buffs.MultipleBuffOptionsFound: Multiple buff options found for {name}. Please select which one to apply:
buffs.ApplyOnCastTooltip: Apply immediately when the spell is cast.
buffs.ApplyOnTurnTooltip: Apply at the start of the target's next turn.
buffs.AllowSwitchingEachRound: Allow targets to switch variants each round
buffs.TargetCapExceeded: You can only select {cap} target(s) for this spell.
buffs.NotEnoughSpellSlots: Not enough spell slots to cast this spell on all targets! ({remaining} remaining, {needed} needed)

PersistentNoTargets.current: Persistent Spell: target one or more tokens.
PersistentNoTargets.selected: Persistent Spell: select one or more tokens.
PersistentNoTargets.message: Persistent Spell: no targets were stored on this chat card.
